channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Forest bike no. 26853 dumped, 24th August
item.description:
Forest bike no. 26853 dumped in middle of payment near 37 Leahurst Road SE135HX. Anyone moving the bike will set off the alarm which will wake up our baby. We urge Forest to pick this bike up asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Leahurst Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drawing flags, 24th August
item.description:
We found IC3 male called Brian Chibambo at Eros place Piccadilly drawing flags on the floor again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 224, Piccadilly Circus, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on pedestrian crossing, 24th August
item.description:
Graffiti on the road markings for the pedestrian crossing. I'm sure whoever tried to paint the St George flag on the floor felt patriotic, but having everyone walk and drive over the flag is hardy respectful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin not closing - dog poo bags everywhere, 24th August
item.description:
Recently reported the same problem and it was marked as resolved, however all that was done was the dog poo bags were removed and the bin itself not fixed. The problem is this bin does not lock closed and foxes have been taking dog waste and other food waste out of the bin and scattering over the pavement. So it has happened once again a few days after it was cleaned up last time. Please replace the bin!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Rise, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 24th August
item.description:
Someone has dumped rubbish, black bags and quilts. This seems to happen on a regular basis. Please address and it might be a good idea to put up signs .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roland Way, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing has been defaced with St George’s cross, 24th August
item.description:
The entire zebra crossing has been defaced with St George’s Cross flags painted on every white rectangle - this occurred during the immigration protests and is clearly intended to intimidate non-British citizens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unattended hired bikes, 24th August
item.description:
Left inappropriately lime bikes outside ever well Chinese medicine at Little Newport Street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Little Newport Street, Chinatown, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped lime bikes, 24th August
item.description:
Line bikes are continuously piled up in this spot ont the corner of Wordsworth and Prince George Roads posing a barrier to disabled pedestrians
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prince George Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New graffitied clothes bin in unkept weeds, 24th August
item.description:
A graffitied clothes bin has been dumped in the middle of overgrown weeds which makes the space look like a dumping ground. It is not clear if a licence was obtained.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wordsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Quran Sellers, 24th August
item.description:
Blocking pedestrian way, unlicensed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leicester Court, Chinatown, City of Westminster

item.title: Flytipping, 24th August
item.description:
This carpet was flytipped today. Further to previous reports, the broken green planter attracts repeated flytipping and rubbish - can this please be removed as it’s attracting flytipping at least three times a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Flaxman Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste bin overflowing, 24th August
item.description:
The bin is overflowing and cant be used, this appears to be an issue with lots of bins in Beckenham currently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smelly drain, 24th August
item.description:
Smelly drain. It has been ongoing for many weeks. Can you organise for drain to be cleaned, smell is travelling into homes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48-54, The Marlowes, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping unwanted rubbish bins, 24th August
item.description:
The green waste bin appeared after they moved in and the black bin full of rubbish came out this weekend

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Lane, Widmore, London

item.title: All public bins on this stretch of road are full, 24th August
item.description:
Hi, All public bins on this stretch of road are full and overflowing and havent been emptied for a long time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Road, Beckenham, London

Large chair dumped on the pavement. Has been there for over a week.

item.title: Bus stop dangerous angle, 24th August
item.description:
Health and safety risks Pedestrians are using the main road to walk on as the pavement is blocked. Seen many people walking into main road as no.pavement space The bus stop is leaning at a hazardous angle and there is a temporary bus stop sign below this ..so people waiting just below this danger. This looks as though has been reported early August and no action taken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 24th August
item.description:
The car has been left there for some time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vanbrugh Hill, East Greenwich, London
